results.title: Carnivorous plants
results.brief_description: Shows the unusual structure and behaviour of the Venus Flytrap, Trumpet Plant, Cobra Plant, Pitcher Plant, Sundew Plant and Utricularia, which are all species of carnivorous plants. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: A Touch of the terminals
results.creator_credit: Philip Bull and Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch
results.brief_description: Its the machine age, computers are taking over - reducing the workforce and increasing productivity. The unemployed can’t afford to buy the products produced and therefore the company can’t sell its products and is losing money. To make money they cull more workers, bring in more machines and again more unemployed who can’t afford to buy. A satirical look at the effects of computers. Cast includes Martin Vaughan, Michael Ross, Ray Anderson, Tony Llewellyn-Jones.

results.title: Doled out
results.brief_description: A film about being unemployed and on the dole in Australia in 1978. In interviews and short dramatised sketches, the causes and effects of unemployment are examined in statements by people who are tired of being called “bludgers”. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: St Albans: an ethnic programme
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: St Albans is a multilingual, multicultural community where 85% of the population are migrants from non-English speaking countries. St Albans East Primary School, with a school’s commission grant, employ parents in a program to increase the children’s awareness of community languages and culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Hart and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre

results.title: Samoa I Sisifo
results.creator_credit: Dan Tristam, Jamie Wilson and Juniper Films
results.brief_description: Portrays the interweaving of traditional values and progressive development of the Samoan islanders giving an overall coverage of the people and their lifestyle. Covers also the tourist industry and shows the celebration of Western Samoa’s 10th anniversary of independence.

results.title: A Career in nursing
results.brief_description:
Presents an overview of nursing training in Australia and gives a general outline of what is involved in each of the three years of training required for qualifications as a nursing sister. Points out avenuyes open after qualification.
NB: Out of date information.

results.title: Exhaustion exposure
results.brief_description: Deals with the causes of exhaustion exposure. Covers such topics as: food intake; mixed ability walking groups; producing, losing and controlling body heat; emergency procedure when in the mountains. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Concerto for ads and heads
results.brief_description: A day in the life of one of Melbourne’s television stations, as filmed off the screen, one frame in every 10 seconds in 1979. A powerful observation of the content of ‘our box in the corner’ 20 years ago. Set to the music of Bach.

results.title: The Last wild river
results.brief_description: Covers an expedition in 1977 by four people including Bob Brown and Peter Thompson, down the wild Franklin River in Western Tasmania using rubber rafts. Shows much of the aesthetic and recreational value of this wilderness environment and introduces the conservation dispute focused on this area.

results.title: Aujourd'hui en France: trois jours trois, photographes
results.brief_description: One of a series of films covering various aspects of the French lifestyle, history and culture. This film studies three French photographers - Jean-Loup Sieff, Robert Doisneau, Bruno Barbey - and their different styles.
